sen.j: 令制国一覧 > 畿内 > 山城国 > 久世郡
sen.e: List of provinces administered in the past by the ryo-sei, or administrative codes (令制国)/Kinai (five provinces in the immediate vicinity of Kyoto)/Yamashiro Province/Kuse-gun

sen.j: 久世郡（くせぐん、くぜのこおり）は京都府・山城国の郡である。
sen.e: Kuse-gun was formerly a district in Yamashiro Province, and is a district in Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuse-gun was formerly a district in Yamashiro Province, and is a district in Kyoto Prefecture.
Kuse-gun was formerly a district in Yamashiro Province, and is a district in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 現在は以下の1町を含む。

sen.j: 久御山町（くみやまちょう）
sen.e: Kumiyama-cho
Kumiyama-cho
Kumiyama-cho

sen.j: 1879年（明治12年）4月10日 - 郡区町村編制法に基づき宇治郡宇治郷に宇治・久世両郡合同の郡役所を設置。
sen.e: April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), a district office for both Uji-gun and Kuse-gun was established in Uji-go, Uji-gun.
April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), a district office for both Uji-gun and Kuse-gun was established in Uji-go, Uji-gun.
April 10, 1879: Based on the Gun-ku-cho-son henseiho (Counties, Wards, Towns, and Villages Organization Code), a district office for both Uji-gun and Kuse-gun was established in Uji-go, Uji-gun.

sen.j: （郡制下では久世郡宇治町に置かれる）
sen.e: Under the gunsei (County System Law), the district office was established in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun.
The district office was established in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun under the gunsei (County System Law).
The district office was established in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun under the gunsei (County System Law).

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 - 町村制施行に伴い、久世郡に宇治町・淀町、槇島村・小倉村・大久保村・久津川村・富野荘村・寺田村・佐山村・御牧村が成立する。
sen.e: April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Uji-cho, Yodo-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, Terada-mura, Sayama-mura, and Mimaki-mura were established in Kuse-gun.

April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Uji-cho, Yodo-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, Terada-mura, Sayama-mura, and Mimaki-mura were established in Kuse-gun.

April 1, 1889: As a result of the enactment of the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Uji-cho, Yodo-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, Terada-mura, Sayama-mura, and Mimaki-mura were established in Kuse-gun.
Kuse-gun was comprised of two towns and eight villages.
Kuse-gun was comprised of two towns and eight villages.
Kuse-gun was comprised of two towns and eight villages.

sen.j: 1935年（昭和10年）4月1日 - 淀町が綴喜郡美豆村を編入。
sen.e: April 1, 1935: Yodo-cho absorbed Mizu-mura, Tsuzuki-gun.
April 1, 1935: Yodo-cho absorbed Mizu-mura, Tsuzuki-gun.
April 1, 1935: Yodo-cho absorbed Mizu-mura, Tsuzuki-gun.

sen.j: 1936年（昭和11年）2月11日 - 淀町が乙訓郡淀村を編入。
sen.e: February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho absorbed Yodo-mura, Otokuni-gun.
February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho absorbed Yodo-mura, Otokuni-gun.
February 11, 1936: Yodo-cho absorbed Yodo-mura, Otokuni-gun.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）7月1日 - 久世郡宇治町に宇治郡・久世郡を管轄する宇治地方事務所を設置。
sen.e: July 1, 1942: Uji local office was set up in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun to administer Uji-gun and Kuse-gun.
July 1, 1942: Uji local office was set up in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun to administer Uji-gun and Kuse-gun.
July 1, 1942: Uji local office was set up in Uji-cho, Kuse-gun to administer Uji-gun and Kuse-gun.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）3月1日 - 宇治町・槇島村・小倉村・大久保村が宇治郡東宇治町と合併し、宇治市が発足、郡より離脱。
sen.e: March 1, 1951: Uji-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun were merged to form Uji City, and Uji City was separated from the gun (district) system.
March 1, 1951: Uji-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun were merged to form Uji City, and Uji City was separated from the gun (district) system.
March 1, 1951: Uji-cho, Makishima-mura, Ogura-mura, Okubo-mura, and Higashi-uji-cho in Uji-gun were merged to form Uji City, and Uji City was separated from the gun (district) system.
Kuse-gun was comprised of one town and five villages.

sen.j: 1951年（昭和26年）4月1日 - 久津川村・富野荘村・寺田村が綴喜郡青谷村と合併し、城陽町が発足。
sen.e: April 1, 1951: Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, Terada-mura, and Aotani-mura in Tsuzuki-gun were merged to form Joyo-cho.
April 1, 1951: Kutsukawa-mura, Tonosho-mura, Terada-mura, and Aotani-mura in Tsuzuki-gun were merged to form Joyo-cho.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）10月1日 - 佐山村・御牧村が合併し、久御山町が発足。
sen.e: October 1, 1954: Sayama-mura and Mimaki-mura were merged to form Kumiyama-cho.
October 1, 1954: Sayama-mura and Mimaki-mura were merged to form Kumiyama-cho.

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）4月1日 - 淀町が京都市伏見区に編入。
sen.e: April 1, 1957: Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Yodo-cho.
April 1, 1957: Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City absorbed Yodo-cho.

Kuse-gun was comprised of two towns.

sen.j: 1972年（昭和47年）5月5日 - 城陽町が市制施行し、城陽市となり郡より離脱。
sen.e: May 5, 1972: By implementing the shisei (grant of city status), Joyo-cho became Joyo City and was separated from the gun (district) system.
May 5, 1972: By implementing the shisei (grant of city status), Joyo-cho became Joyo City and was separated from the gun (district) system.
